Package gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class VectFuns

java.lang.Object
gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.VectFuns
public final class VectFuns extends Object
A collection of functions on vectors

  • Method Details

    • LoS

      public static boolean LoS(Vect3 so, Vect3 si, double D, double H)
      Returns true if aircraft are in loss of separation at time 0.
      Parameters:
      so - the relative position of the ownship aircraft
      si - the relative position of the traffic aircraft
      D - the minimum horizontal distance
      H - the minimum vertical distance
      Returns:
      true, if aircraft are in loss of separation

    • rightOfLine

      public static boolean rightOfLine(Vect2 so, Vect2 vo, Vect2 si)
      Returns true if si is on the right side of the line (so,vo)
      Parameters:
      so - ownship position
      vo - ownship velocity
      si - traffic aircraft position
      Returns:
      true if is to the right of line (so,vo)

    • rightOfLinePoints

      public static int rightOfLinePoints(Vect2 a, Vect2 b, Vect2 p)
      Return if point p is to the right or left of the line from A to B
      Parameters:
      a - point A
      b - point B
      p - point P
      Returns:
      1 if to the right or collinear, -1 if to the left.

    • interpolate

      public static Vect3 interpolate(Vect3 v1, Vect3 v2, double f)
      Interpolate between two vectors.
      Parameters:
      v1 - first position
      v2 - second position
      f - a fraction. Should be between 0 and 1 to interpolate. If 0, then v1 is returned, if 1 then v2 is returned.
      Returns:
      interpolated vector

    • interpolateVelocity

      public static Velocity interpolateVelocity(Velocity v1, Velocity v2, double f)
      Interpolate between two velocity vectors.
      Parameters:
      v1 - first position
      v2 - second position
      f - a fraction. Should be between 0 and 1 to interpolate. If 0, then v1 is returned, if 1 then v2 is returned.
      Returns:
      interpolated vector

      public static double angle_between(Vect2 a, Vect2 b, Vect2 c)
      Return angle between P1-P2 and P2-P3
      Parameters:
      a - point 1
      b - point 2 (intersection of two lines)
      c - point 3
      Returns:
      angle between two lines

    • divergentHorizGt

      public static boolean divergentHorizGt(Vect2 s, Vect2 vo, Vect2 vi, double minRelSpeed)
      determines if divergent and relative speed is greater than a specified minimum relative speed
      Parameters:
      s - relative position of ownship with respect to traffic
      vo - initial velocity of ownship
      vi - initial velocity of traffic
      minRelSpeed - the desired minimum relative speed
      Returns:
      true iff divergent and relative speed is greater than a specified minimum relative speed

      Parameters:
      so - ownship position
      vo - ownship velocity
      si - intruder position
      vi - intruder velocity
      Returns:
      true, if divergent

      public static double tau(Vect3 s, Vect3 vo, Vect3 vi)
      time of closest approach, if parallel return Double.MAX_VALUE
      Parameters:
      s - relative position of aircraft
      vo - velocity of ownship
      vi - velocity of traffic
      Returns:
      time of closest approach (can be negative)

    • distAtTau

      public static double distAtTau(Vect3 s, Vect3 vo, Vect3 vi, boolean futureOnly)
      distance at time of closest approach
      Parameters:
      s - relative position of aircraft
      vo - velocity of ownship
      vi - velocity of traffic
      futureOnly - if true then in divergent cases use distance now
      Returns:
      distance at time of closest approach

    • Q

      public static Vect2 Q(Vect2 s, double D, int eps)
      Q function (relative tangent point)
      Parameters:
      s - point outside circle with origin center
      D - radius of circle
      eps - direction (+/-1)
      Returns:
      point on origin-centered circle that is tangent and passes through s, or INVALID if s is within the circle

    • distance

      public static double distance(Vect2 soA, Vect2 soB)
      Distance between two points. Effectively soA.Sub(soB).norm();
      Parameters:
      soA -
      soB -
      Returns:
      distance

    • distanceH

      public static double distanceH(Vect3 soA, Vect3 soB)
      Calculate the horizontal distance between two points.
      Parameters:
      soA - point A
      soB - point B
      Returns:
      horizontal distance between points.

    • intersection

      public static Pair<Vect3,Double> intersection(Vect3 so3, Vect3 vo3, Vect3 si3, Vect3 vi3)
      Computes 2D intersection point of two lines, but also finds z component (projected by time from line o) This z-component is constrained to be within the z components of the defining points.
      Parameters:
      so3 - starting point of line o
      vo3 - direction vector for line o
      si3 - starting point of line i
      vi3 - direction vector of line i
      Returns:
      Pair (2-dimensional point of intersection, relative time of intersection, relative to the so3) Note the intersection may be in the past (i.e. negative time) If the lines are 2-D parallel (including collinear) this returns the pair (0,NaN).

    • intersection2D

      public static Pair<Vect2,Double> intersection2D(Vect2 so, Vect2 vo, Vect2 si, Vect2 vi)
      Intersection of 2 (2D) lines
      Parameters:
      so - current position on line 1
      vo - velocity of so along line 1
      si - current position on line 2
      vi - velocity of si on line 2
      Returns:
      position and time along line 1, or (0,NaN) if there is no intersection (or the lines are the same).

    • intersectSegment

      public static double intersectSegment(Vect2 si, Vect2 vi, Vect2 a, Vect2 b)
      NOT FULLY DEBUGGED !! Return the distance at which si, traveling in direction vi, will intersect with segment ab (inclusive)
      Parameters:
      si - position of vehicle
      vi - velocity of vehicle
      a - an end point of segment
      b - an end point of segment
      Returns:
      distance of intersection, or negative if no intersection

    • timeOfIntersection

      public static double timeOfIntersection(Vect3 so3, Vect3 vo3, Vect3 si3, Vect3 vi3)
      Computes 2D intersection point of two infinite lines
      Parameters:
      so3 - starting point of line 1
      vo3 - direction vector for line 1
      si3 - starting point of line 2
      vi3 - direction vector of line 2
      Returns:
      time the OWNSHIP (so3) will reach the point. Note that the intruder (si3) may have already passed this point. If the lines are parallel, this returns NaN.

    • intersectionAvgZ

      public static Pair<Vect3,Double> intersectionAvgZ(Vect3 so1, Vect3 so2, double dto, Vect3 si1, Vect3 si2)
      Computes 2D intersection point of two lines, but also finds z component as average of the closest end point of each line) This z-component is constrained to be within the z components of the defining points.
      Parameters:
      so1 - starting point of line o
      so2 - ending point of line o
      dto - delta time
      si1 - starting point of line i
      si2 - ending point of line i
      Returns:
      Pair (2-dimensional point of intersection, relative time of intersection, relative to the so1) This includes the average altitude between the *endpoints* closest to the point of intersection Note the intersection may be in the past (i.e. negative time) If the lines are parallel, this returns the pair (0,NaN).

    • intersection2D

      public static Pair<Vect2,Double> intersection2D(Vect2 so1, Vect2 so2, double dto, Vect2 si1, Vect2 si2)
      2D intersection of two infinite lines
      Parameters:
      so1 - first point of line o
      so2 - second point of line o
      dto - the delta time between point so and point so2.
      si1 - first point of line i
      si2 - second point of line i
      Returns:
      a pair: intersection point and the delta time from point "so" to the intersection, can be negative if intersect point is in the past. Returns (0,NaN) if there is no intersection (or the lines are the same).

    • intersectSegments

      public static Pair<Vect2,Double> intersectSegments(Vect2 so, Vect2 so2, Vect2 si, Vect2 si2)
      2D intersection of two segments (finite length) at a single point This treats overlapping segments as no intersection
      Parameters:
      so - first point of line o
      so2 - second point of line o
      si - first point of line i
      si2 - second point of line i
      Returns:
      a pair: intersection point and the fraction of the distance from point "so" to the intersection. Returns (INVALID,fractDist) if there is no intersection (or the lines are the same).

    • distPerp

      public static Pair<Double,Double> distPerp(Vect2 s, Vect2 v, Vect2 q)
      returns the perpendicular time and distance between line defined by s,v and point q.
      Parameters:
      s - point on line
      v - velocity vector of line
      q - a point not on the line
      Returns:
      time to perpendicular location on line (relative to s) and perpendicular distance

    • distPerp

      public static Pair<Double,Double> distPerp(Vect3 s, Vect3 v, Vect3 q)

    • closestPoint3

      public static Vect3 closestPoint3(Vect3 a, Vect3 b, Vect3 so)
      Return the closest point on the line a-b to point so as a 3D norm EXPERIMENTAL
      Parameters:
      a - a point to define a line
      b - another point to define a line
      so - a point
      Returns:
      the closest point

      Parameters:

      b - another point to define a line
      so - a point
      Returns:
      the closest point

      Parameters:

      b - another point to define a line
      so - a point
      Returns:
      the closest point

      Parameters:
      a - a point to define a line
      b - another point to define a line
      so - a point
      Returns:
      the closest point

      public static Vect2 closestPointOnSegment(Vect2 a, Vect2 b, Vect2 so)

    • closestPointOnSegment3

      public static Vect3 closestPointOnSegment3(Vect3 a, Vect3 b, Vect3 so)

    • closestPointOnSegment3Extended

      public static Pair<Vect3,Double> closestPointOnSegment3Extended(Vect3 a, Vect3 b, Vect3 so)
      return point and ratio of distance between a and b (0=a, 1=b)
      Parameters:
      a - a point to define a line
      b - another point to define a line
      so - a point
      Returns:
      point and ratio (0=a, 1=b)

    • distanceToSegment

      public static double distanceToSegment(Vect2 a, Vect2 b, Vect2 so)

    • rotate

      public static Vect2 rotate(Vect2 p, double angle)
      Rotate p around origin.
      Parameters:
      p - point to move
      angle - angle of rotation (positive is clockwise)
      Returns:
      new position for p

    • behind

      public static boolean behind(Vect2 x, Vect2 so, Vect2 vo)
      Returns true if x is "behind" so , that is, x is within the region behind the perpendicular line to vo through so.
      Parameters:
      x - a position
      so - aircraft position
      vo - aircraft velocity
      Returns:
      true, if x is behind so

    • passingDirection

      public static int passingDirection(Vect3 so, Vect3 vo, Vect3 si, Vect3 vi)
      Returns values indicating whether the ownship state will pass in front of or behind the intruder (from a horizontal perspective)
      Parameters:
      so - ownship position
      vo - ownship velocity
      si - intruder position
      vi - intruder velocity
      Returns:
      1 if ownship will pass in front (or collide, from a horizontal sense), -1 if ownship will pass behind, 0 if divergent or parallel

    • dirForBehind

      public static int dirForBehind(Vect2 so, Vect2 vo, Vect2 si, Vect2 vi)

    • dirForBehind

      public static int dirForBehind(Vect3 so, Vect3 vo, Vect3 si, Vect3 vi)

    • planeNormal

      public static Vect3 planeNormal(Vect3 a, Vect3 b, Vect3 c)
      Calculate the normal (perpendicular vector) of a plane defined by 3 points. This is not necessarily a unit vector.
      Parameters:
      a - point 1
      b - point 2
      c - point 3
      Returns:
      the normal vector

    • onSide

      public static int onSide(Vect2 s, Vect2 v, Vect2 p)
      Return the side (+1 right, -1 left) of the ray s(point),v(velocity) that point p is on. If value is zero, p is on the line (given no floating point issues)
      Parameters:
      s - position vector
      v - velocity vector
      p - another position vector
      Returns:
      (+1 right, -1 left)

    • internalCenterOfSimilitude

      public static Vect2 internalCenterOfSimilitude(Vect2 c1, double r1, Vect2 c2, double r2)
      Return the interior point where the lines between two circles' tangents intersect (from Wolfram Mathworld). A line tangent to both circles will pass through this point
      Parameters:
      c1 - center of circle 1
      r1 - radius of circle 1
      c2 - center of circle 2
      r2 - radius of circle 2
      Returns:
      interior center of similitude. This version will test if the circles overlap and return INVALID in that case.

    • externalCenterOfSimilitude

      public static Vect2 externalCenterOfSimilitude(Vect2 c1, double r1, Vect2 c2, double r2)
      Return the interior point where the lines between two circles' tangents intersect, if they have different radii (from Wolfram Mathworld) A line tangent to both circles will pass through this point
      Parameters:
      c1 - center of circle 1
      r1 - radius of circle 1
      c2 - center of circle 2
      r2 - radius of circle 2
      Returns:
      exterior center of similitude. This version will test if the circles overlap and return INVALID in that case. It will also return INVALID if they have the same radii.

    • tangentSegments

      public static List<Pair<Vect2,Vect2>> tangentSegments(Vect2 c1, double r1, Vect2 c2, double r2)
      Return a list of segments that are tangent to two circles
      Parameters:
      c1 - center of circle 1
      r1 - radius of circle 1
      c2 - center of circle 2
      r2 - radius of circle 2
      Returns:
      endpoints of segments (from c1 to c2) tangent to both circles. This list will be empty if the circles overlap.
